result.execSummary:
The defendant George Ash Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Ash Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George Ash Jones in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant George Ash Jones in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  DNA notification given. 

 Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with 30 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by the end of probation in count 2.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0
days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months
 with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Port Supermart.

- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within the term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

filed.  As to count 1: Disorderly Conduct contrary to sec 947.01(1), Wis. Stats. a Class B Misdemeanor, As to count 2: Resisting an Officer contrary to sec 946.41 (1) Wis. Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant George Ash Jones in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant George Ash Jones in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Port Super Mart -  3876 N Port Washington Ave.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant George Ash Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant George Ash Jones in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
